thread.title: Pelosi, Dems celebrate Iran nuclear deal passage
thread.title_full: Pelosi, Dems celebrate Iran nuclear deal passage - POLITICO

author: Glenn Thrush
title: Pelosi, Dems celebrate Iran nuclear deal passage
text:
Congressional Democrats celebrated the roll-out of the Iran nuclear deal at a private reception on Wednesday hosted by Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi. The nonproliferation deal was officially adopted Sunday after a brutal congressional review earlier this year that saw Democrats narrowly push forward the agreement over the strong objections of Republicans.
At the private reception, attended by White House Chief of Staff Â, Pelosi thanked the House Democrats who led the whip operation on the Iran deal, including Texas Rep. Lloyd Doggett, North Carolina Rep. David Price and Illinois Rep. Jan Schakowsky.
Many Democrats were subject to an intense lobbying effort from pro-Israel groups to oppose the deal, a fact McDonough acknowledged in his remarks. McDonough said “science” and “the national interest” triumphed in the battle over the deal.
Pelosi, who took to carrying around a three-ring binder of statements from lawmakers in support of the deal, was praised by fellow Democrats for her work on the issue.
"Without each and everyone one of you this would not have happened,” Pelosi responded.
Former ambassador Thomas Pickering, along with Reps. Gerry Connolly of Virginia, Peter Welch of Vermont, Debbie Dingell of Michigan, Jerry Nadler of New York and another two dozen lawmakers attended the event.
